One way to mitigate this risk is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0, and then set the desired value afterwards, per [this ERC-20 issue](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729).     * A simpler workaround is to use `increaseAllowance` or `decreaseAllowance`, below."},"burnFrom(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Burn `value` attotokens from `account`, if sender has that much allowance from `account`."},"changeMaxSupply(uint256)":{"notice":"Change the maximum supply allowed."},"changeMinter(address)":{"notice":"Change who holds the `minter` role."},"changePauser(address)":{"notice":"Change who holds the `pauser` role."},"changeTxFeeHelper(address)":{"notice":"Change the contract that helps with transaction fee calculation."},"constructor":"Initialize critical fields.","decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Decrease `spender`'s allowance of the sender's tokens."},"getEternalStorageAddress()":{"notice":"Accessor for eternal storage contract address."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Increase `spender`'s allowance of the sender's tokens."},"mint(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Mint `value` new attotokens to `account`."},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause the contract."},"renounceOwnership(string)":{"notice":"Set `_owner` to the 0 address. nodes.documentation:
Make a different address the EternalStorage contract's reserveAddress.
 This will break this contract, so only do it if you're
 abandoning this contract, e.g., for an upgrade.

nodes.name: allowance

nodes.documentation: Transfer `value` attoRSV from `msg.sender` to `to`.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation:
Approve `spender` to spend `value` attotokens on behalf of `msg.sender`.
     * Beware that changing a nonzero allowance with this method brings the risk that
someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One
way to mitigate this risk is to first reduce the spender's allowance
to 0, and then set the desired value afterwards, per
[this ERC-20 issue](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729).
     * A simpler workaround is to use `increaseAllowance` or `decreaseAllowance`, below.
     * @param spender address The address which will spend the funds.
@param value uint256 How many attotokens to allow `spender` to spend.
nodes.name: approve
transferFrom
increaseAllowance
decreaseAllowance

nodes.documentation: Mint `value` new attotokens to `account`.
nodes.name: mint

nodes.documentation: Burn `value` attotokens from `account`, if sender has that much allowance from `account`.
nodes.name: burnFrom

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfer of `value` attotokens from `from` to `to`.
 Internal; doesn't check permissions.
nodes.name: _transfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev Burn `value` attotokens from `account`.
 Internal; doesn't check permissions.
nodes.name: _burn

nodes.documentation:
@dev Set `spender`'s allowance on `holder`'s tokens to `value` attotokens.
 Internal; doesn't check permissions.
nodes.name: _approve

     * A simpler workaround is to use `increaseAllowance` or `decreaseAllowance`, below.

devdoc.details: An ERC-20 token with minting, burning, pausing, and user freezing. Based on OpenZeppelin's [implementation](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-solidity/blob/41aa39afbc13f0585634061701c883fe512a5469/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol). * Non-constant-sized data is held in ReserveEternalStorage, to facilitate potential future upgrades.

allowance(address,address).return: how many attoRSV `holder` has allowed `spender` to control.

params.spender: address The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: uint256 How many attotokens to allow `spender` to spend.

balanceOf(address).return: how many attoRSV are held by `holder`.

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.subtractedValue: How many attotokens to decrease the allowance by.

params.addedValue: How many attotokens to increase the allowance by.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.

nominateNewOwner(address).details: Nominates a new owner `newOwner`. Requires a follow-up `acceptOwnership`. Can only be called by the current owner.

nominatedOwner().details: Returns the address of the current nominated owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.from: address The address to send tokens from.
params.to: address The address to send tokens to.
params.value: uint256 The number of attotokens to send.

devdoc.title: The Reserve Token

approve(address,uint256).notice: Approve `spender` to spend `value` attotokens on behalf of `msg.sender`.     * Beware that changing a nonzero allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One way to mitigate this risk is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0, and then set the desired value afterwards, per [this ERC-20 issue](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729).     * A simpler workaround is to use `increaseAllowance` or `decreaseAllowance`, below.

burnFrom(address,uint256).notice: Burn `value` attotokens from `account`, if sender has that much allowance from `account`.

changeTxFeeHelper(address).notice: Change the contract that helps with transaction fee calculation.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Decrease `spender`'s allowance of the sender's tokens.

getEternalStorageAddress().notice: Accessor for eternal storage contract address.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: Increase `spender`'s allowance of the sender's tokens.

renounceOwnership(string).notice: Set `_owner` to the 0 address. Only do this to deliberately lock in the current permissions.     * THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE! Call this only if you know what you're doing and why you're doing it!

transferEternalStorage(address).notice: Make a different address the EternalStorage contract's reserveAddress. This will break this contract, so only do it if you're abandoning this contract, e.g., for an upgrade.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfer approved tokens from one address to another.
